snippet: On a two-day trip to China, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany concentrated on winning support from Prime Minister Wen Jiabao to help ease the sovereign debt crisis in Europe.
abstract: Focus of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's trip to China is on the economy, not human rights; Merkel reassures Chinese leaders about the stability of the euro zone and her country's determination to keep it together.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: David Barboza reported from Shanghai, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: On a two-day trip to China, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany concentrated on winning support from Prime Minister Wen Jiabao to help ease the sovereign debt crisis in Europe.

headline.seo: In China, Merkel Focuses on Economy, Not Rights
headline.main: Merkel’s China Trip Focuses on Economy, Not Rights
headline.print_headline: Merkel’s China Trip Focuses on Economy, Not Rights
